short: Hackneyed is a word for language that doesn't pack a punch since it's overused and trite. "Roses are red, violets are..." ā enough already?! That's hackneyed stuff.
long: Hackneyed is usually used to describe tired writing, but you can also refer to the hackneyed plots of television sit-coms or the hackneyed jokes of your Uncle Fred. But, most often, you will see hackneyed before the word phrase to refer to a specific clichĆ© that is annoying the heck out of someone.
